unnormalised: ## Going Viral, Desi Style: What's Trending in Indian Social Media
normalised: ## Going Viral, Desi Style: What's Trending in Indian Social Media

unnormalised: Hey guys! So, you wanna be a social media superstar, right? Everyone dreams of that viral moment, that instant fame that makes you the next Bhuvan Bam or Prajakta Koli. But what actually *makes* something go viral in the Indian context? It's not just about luck, yaar. It's about understanding the pulse of the nation.
normalised: Hey guys! So, you want to be a social media superstar, right? Everyone dreams of that viral moment, that instant fame that makes you the next Bhuvan Bam or Prajakta Koli. But what actually makes something go viral in the Indian context? It's not just about luck, yaar. It's about understanding the pulse of the nation.

unnormalised: Let's talk trends. Right now, short-form video is KING. Think Instagram Reels, YouTube Shorts – that's where the action is. Dance challenges are HUGE, especially if they're set to a catchy Bollywood song. Remember that "Kacha Badam" craze? That went everywhere! And who can forget those hilarious mimicry videos of politicians during the 2024 elections?!

And who can forget those hilarious mimicry videos of politicians during the two thousand and twenty four elections?!

unnormalised: But beyond the entertainment, there's a real hunger for relatable content. Think about relatable struggles – like the nightmare of booking a Tatkal ticket at 10:00 hrs sharp! Or the joys and pains of dealing with your overly concerned aunties. Content that strikes a chord with everyday Indians is gold.

Or the joys and pains of dealing with your overly concerned aunties. Content that strikes a chord with everyday Indians is gold.

unnormalised: And don't underestimate the power of regional languages. Creating content in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, etc., instantly expands your reach. Imagine a funny reel about navigating the chaotic streets of Mumbai – that's going to resonate with millions.
normalised: And don't underestimate the power of regional languages. Creating content in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, etcetera, instantly expands your reach. Imagine a funny reel about navigating the chaotic streets of Mumbai – that's going to resonate with millions.

unnormalised: Another big trend? Educational content, but make it fun! Think explainers on complex topics, but with a desi twist. Maybe a video explaining cryptocurrency with examples from the stock market, all while sipping chai! People are always looking to learn something new, especially if it's presented in an engaging way.

unnormalised: Of course, jumping on trending topics is key. If the whole country is talking about Chandrayaan-3 launching on 14/07/2023, find a way to contribute to the conversation. Offer your unique perspective, share interesting facts, or even create a funny meme.

Offer your unique perspective, share interesting facts, or even create a funny meme.

unnormalised: And remember, authenticity is key. Don't try to be someone you're not. Let your personality shine through, and people will connect with you. Plus, good lighting and decent audio can go a long way (thanks, Mom!).

unnormalised: Finally, engage with your audience! Respond to comments, ask questions, and create a community. Remember, building a loyal following is more important than just one viral moment. Keep creating, keep experimenting, and who knows, maybe your video will be the next big thing by Diwali (which is on 01/11/2024, mark your calendars!). Good luck, and remember to subscribe!
